attributes.action: Look to widen sanctions against the regime of Robert Mugabe in Zimbabwe
attributes.action_prefix: We the undersigned petition the Prime Minister to
attributes.background:
As long as oil prices remain in their present range some countries will continue to 'protect' their suppliers even though such countries finance the Mugabe regime. The UN should have no difficulty in exposing member states and others and applying commensurate sanctions to them. 
As an example it would appear that Angola, an oil producer, is not only supplying mercenaries to continue the harassment, molestation and murder of the citizens of Zimbabwe but further provides funding (raised through oil revenues, which the West provides, thus factually supporting the regime) and fostering the continuation of the reign of terror.

reasons: Duplicate - this is similar to and/or overlaps with an existing petition or petitions
